p: The discordance (or bias) calculated at individual SNPs is the sum (or difference) of two proportions. To compare groups of SNPs, a Gaussian approximation of the discordance (or bias) distribution was employed and t-statistics compared the difference in means between two groups of SNPs. Normality of the distributions were tested by the Anscombeâ€“Glynn test of kurtosis. Further, non-parametric tests of differences in medians were used in parallel to confirm results.
